comment.text: The "NewFolder" translation key is used to display the label for a new folder creation option in the UI. It will appear on a button or dialog that allows users to create a new folder, as seen in the code snippet from /packages/client/src/helpers/filesUtils.js and /packages/shared/selectors/Files/hooks/useFilesHelper.ts.

usage.context:
return [
 ...((withCreate && [
 {
 isCreateNewItem: true,
 label: initSelectedItemType === "files" ? t("NewFolder") : t("NewRoom"),
 id: "create-folder-item",
 key: "create-folder-item",
 hotkey: "f",
 onBackClick: () => {},
 },

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'නව බහාලුමක්' is a literal translation, it's not the most natural or common way to refer to 'New folder' in Sinhala. 'මතලු' (mathalu) or 'ថ្មី ෆෝල්డර්' (transliteration of 'New Folder') are more standard.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'මතලු' or 'ថ្មី ෆෝල්డර්'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation 'Нови фолдер' uses the English loanword 'фолдер' instead of a more appropriate Serbian equivalent. While understood, it's not ideal for maintaining linguistic consistency.

The Serbian translation 'Novi folder' doesn't accurately reflect the English 'New folder'. The correct translation should be 'Nova mapa'. 'Folder' is an English term, and its direct translation is 'mapa'.
The Turkish translation "Yeni dosya" translates to "New file", not "New folder".  "Yeni klasör" would be a more accurate translation for "New folder".
The translation "Папку" is not a complete translation of "New folder". It only translates to "Folder". It's missing the "New" part.
